content:
Meeting 2021-09-21T17:00:00+02:00 @T-clippy (T-45 min, sorry for the late reminder)

Agenda

  • ...?

I took a long weekend vacation, so I'm out of the loop. If there is anything we have to talk about, let me know.

I think it is time to admit this to myself: I haven't participated in clippy in any meaningful way in the last two years and should probably step down. I still want to help when there are any kind of impl questions wrt rustc APIs, linting logic, MIR linting, or on code crimes I have committed in clippy, but me being part of the team does not help anyone.

Thanks for all your contributions over the years! We'll definitely keep pinging you for MIR questions :) Also a big thank you from me personally for introducing me to Clippy and teaching me the art of reviewing Clippy PRs!

Do you want to be removed from the teams repo? If so, do you want to do this yourself or should I submit the PR?
I'll just take this chance and do it myself :smile:
Meeting time :wave:
Should be a short meeting if no one has anything. Just wanted to know, if anyone disagrees with clippy#7673
(since there are currently only 3 replies including me and this is a pretty big change)
If not, we can already end the meeting @triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
@xFrednet go ahead!

I have one general question, do we maybe want to host clippy's documentation somewhere online? Maybe on our GH Pages or ask the infra team if we can also host it under https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly like rustc's docs?
With the documentation I mean the output of cargo doc
hmmm, we could!
that's a neat idea
perhaps on our gh-pages
I find myself often referencing them in Reviews and always linking to the code itself xD

I wanted to address this question, once we have the book finished. Our GH pages are already used for

With the documentation I mean the output of cargo doc

Ah. yeah GH pages are still tricky, since we already host the lint documentation there
Having a pretty searchable index would be nice

flip1995 said:

I wanted to address this question, once we have the book finished. Our GH pages are already used for

With the documentation I mean the output of cargo doc

Ah. yeah GH pages are still tricky, since we already host the lint documentation there

True we could maybe use https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/internal/...
But maybe we could modify the landing page of our gh pages to link to the book/ cargo doc documentation
that are also hosted on the GH pages
We'll probably have the same problem when we want to publish our md book
yeah
IMO It seems reasonable to have a dev namespace in our GH pages for stuff like this
All the other books are hosted at docs.rust-lang.org
That would be the second option, either one would work IMO. We could also ask the infra team what they would prefer :thinking:
not sure if cargo or other tools hosts it's internal documentation anywhere.
or if we'd be the first
https://docs.rs/cargo/0.56.0/cargo/
I'm not sure if that link is up to date, but that turned up when I searched google for it :upside_down:
Ah ok, so cargo is published on crates.io.
and with that also on docs.rs
Correct, but we decided against publishing Clippy to crates.io
But we don't really want this, because people may start trying to install Clippy via cargo install
I'm guessing that that's also the reason my rustc's documentation is not hosted on docs.rs
rustfmt is at https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/nightly-rustc/rustfmt/index.html. So maybe we can also publish the clippy doc there?
yeah we can ask them to enable that as part of the build

So I think the best setup for us would be:

  • Lint doc: GH-pages
  • Internal doc: https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/nightly-rustc/
  • book: https://doc.rust-lang.org/
that would be nicer since it can link to the rnightly-rustc apis
Ok, so @xFrednet want to ask over at #t-infra what would be involved in setting this up?
I'm currently quite busy with university stuff. But I would be happy to work on this in about a month. Would that work? :upside_down:
By then, I should have had time to finish an early version of the book, so yes :)
Awesome! :upside_down:
Great! In that case @triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
And one more small thing to drag the meeting out a bit longer :wink:. Could we maybe update the T-clippy group to include Cameron Steffen, Takayuki Nakata and me :upside_down:
Done!
Thank you!
Thanks for attending! Have a nice rest of your week! :wave:
You too, thank you for the moderation :wave:
@flip1995 rustdoc and rustfmt host their docs on /nightly-rustc
Setting it up is not super complicated, I think you can just add another macro call to tool_doc! in bootstrap/doc.rs
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/641e02f388acc6b1d316a59c605a32d1711a8758/src/bootstrap/doc.rs#L629
Thank you for the reference, that looks like the thing we where looking for :upside_down:
